title: Fix row hover highlight not appearing on mobile in SheetViewer

requirements.text: Fix the row hover highlight (left border stripe and background color change) in the SheetViewer table so it is visible on mobile devices. On touch/mobile screens, CSS :hover pseudo-class does not trigger on tap; replace or supplement the hover-based highlight with a tap/touch-activated highlight using a React state-driven approach (e.g., onTouchStart/onTouchEnd or onClick toggling an 'active' class on the row) so that tapping a row visibly highlights it with the colored left border stripe and background color on mobile. The hover effect should continue to work on desktop as before.

quotes: Same problem Highlight to be not shown

acceptanceCriteria: On mobile (touch screen), tapping a data row in the SheetViewer table causes a visible highlight: a colored left border stripe appears and the row background changes.
The highlight is visible immediately on tap and does not require a long-press or hover gesture.
On desktop, hovering over a row still shows the same left border stripe and background color change as before.
No JavaScript errors are thrown when tapping rows on mobile.
The fix does not break the alternating row shading (zebra striping) when rows are not highlighted.

constraints: Do not modify any files listed in frontend.immutablePaths.
Do not change backend logic or data fetching behavior.
nonGoals: Changing the color palette or overall visual theme.
Fixing any other mobile layout issues beyond the row highlight.
Adding row selection or editing functionality.
